titleInfo.title: First faculty members at LSU c. 1860

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College

mods.abstract: LSU’s first faculty were elected by the Board of Supervisors in August, 1859. William Tecumseh Sherman served as superintendent and professor of engineering. David Boyd was professor of ancient languages and English. Powhattan Clarke became the surgeon and professor of languages. Anthony Vallas, a Hungarian who was exiled from his homeland in 1850, became professor of mathematics and natural philosophy. Francis W. Smith was elected professor of chemistry and commandant of cadets. Not pictured is E. Berté St. Ange, professor of modern languages. A former officer in the French marines, St. Ange had a reputation as a duelist.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: LSU Office of the President Records, Louisiana State University Archives, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, LA.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
